OP031804-d-03-18-04-NCRC.Narrative: JOB NFSWR-18 (REMOTE CONTROL LOCOMOTIVE OPERATION) WAS ATTEMPTING TO COUPLE AND PULL CARS FROM INDUSTRY TRACK #712.  RCO COUPLED LITE LOCOMOTIVE INTO SEVEN (7) CARS AND THEN MADE A REVERSE MOVE TO COUPLE INTO AN ADDITIONAL FOUR (4) CARS INSIDE OF VULCRAFT BUILDING #2.  RCO STATED THAT THE COUPLING MADE AND WAS NOT STRETCHED.  RCO WALKED TO THE REAR OF THE FOUR (4) CARS WHILE MAKING AN INSPECTION OF THE EQUIPMENT AND REMOVING HAND BRAKES.  WHEN THE RCO REACHED THE REAR OF THE CUT OF CARS HE INITIATED A FORWARD MOVE TO PULL ALL ELEVEN (11) CARS OUT OF THE BUILDING.  RCO STATED THE RCL DID NOT IMMEDIATELY RESPOND (CARS DID NOT BEGIN TO MOVE).  WHILE WALKING TOWARD THE LOCOMOTIVE (RCL WAS NOT INSIGHT), THE RCO ATTEMPTED SEVERAL TIMES TO GET THE RCL TO RESPOND BY INCREASING AND DECREASING THETHROTTLE POSITION.  IT WAS UNKNOWN TO THE RCO THAT THE COUPLING BETWEEN THE RCL AND THE FIRST CAR DID NOT MAKE AND RCL (LITE UNIT) WAS MOVING FORWARD (AWAY FROM THE RCO).  AT APPROXIMATELY THE SAME TIME AS RCO REACHED THE OUTSIDE OF VULCRAFT BUILDING #2 AND OBSERVED THE RCL NOT IN SIGHT, A UTILITY EMPLOYEE OBSERVED THE RCL TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED AND RADIOED THAT INFORMATION TO THE RCO.THE RCO SHUT OFF THE OPERATOR CONTROL UNIT IN AN ATTEMPT TO STOP THE RCL.  LOCOMOTIVE EVENT RECORDER INFORMATION AND THE DATA LOG FROM THE RCL INDICATE THAT THE EQUIPMENT WAS SHUT DOWN PRIOR TO THE COLLISION WITH A CUT OF SEVEN (7) UNATTENDED CARS ON TRACK #199. 030401-d-03-19-04-TTIS.Narrative: A 90 CAR LOADED UNIT COAL TRAIN DERAILED THE 5 LEAD LOCOMOTIVES AND THE FIRST 13 CARS.  TRAIN WAS DESCENDING A 1.3% GRADE AT 24 MPH WITH A 15 PSI BRAKE PIPE REDUCTION.  IN THE SPIRAL OF A DEGREE RHCURVE THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR STATED THE LEAD TRUCK OF THEIR LOCOMOTIVE DROPPED DOWN ON CONDUCTOR SIDE FIRST.  TRAIN CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP IN 11 SECONDS.  METHOD OF OPERATION IS A MANUAL BLOCK PERMIT SYSTEM.  APRROXIMATELY 3200 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL WERE RELEASED WHEN THE FUEL TANKS ON THE LEAD ENGINES CSXT 6919 AND 2327 WERE RUPTURED.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE ENVIRONMENTAL CONTRACTORS WERE BROUGHTIN, AND EVERY EFFORT IS BEING MADE TO COMPLETELY RESTORE THE ENVIRONMENT IN THE AREA.

EVIDENCE SHOWS CSX CREW MADE A HARD COUPLING, DERAILING AN EMPTY CAR IN THE CONSIST.  THE CREW DRAGGED THE DERAILED CAR APPROXIMATELY 13 CAR LENGTHS WHERE IT STRUCK THE GRADE CROSSING AND CAUSED ANOTHER 5CARS TO DERAIL AS WELL.
